issues: Petitioner did not meet consultation requirement
Petitioner did not show Beneficiary satisfied at least three of eight possible forms of documentation
New evidence and claims submitted on appeal not considered
Beneficiary does not have a major, internationally recognized award
Beneficiary did not meet the awards criterion
Beneficiary did not meet the memberships criterion
Published materials criterion not clearly established
criteria_met: critical or essential capacity under 8 C.F.R. § 214.2(o)(3)(B)(iii)(7)
criteria_not_met: documentation of receipt of nationally or internationally recognized prizes or awards
documentation of membership in associations requiring outstanding achievements judged by recognized experts
published material in professional or major trade publications or major media about the alien
procedural_issues: new evidence submitted on appeal was not considered as it was not presented before the Director
key_evidence: screenshots from globo.com reporting the Brazilian women's team won the tournament
photograph purportedly of the Beneficiary holding a trophy
screenshots from Wikipedia about the tournament
various training and preparation certificates for the Beneficiary
published articles that talk about the beneficiary as a coach (incomplete record)
notes: The appeal was dismissed because the petitioner failed to submit sufficient evidence meeting at least three regulatory criteria for the O-1 visa classification. New evidence submitted on appeal was not considered.
